Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the medical sciences, and through its completion, its end has been reached, and through its explanations and clarifications, it seems to me that I have completed it for you with this treatise, which is a part of the operative art with the hands, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operative art with the hands is almost entirely absent in our region and time, the science of it is greatly endangered, and its knowledge is obstructed; and there remain only some small descriptions in the books of the ancients, which have been misinterpreted and have fallen into error and hesitation, so that the understanding of it is clouded and its strength and art are weakened.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revitalize it [the operative art] through the organization of this treatise, in accordance with the method of explanation, clarification, and abbreviation; and so that it may come equipped with the forms of cautery instruments and other tools of the craft, including their explanation and preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a skilled craftsman with his hands is not easily found in our time is because the art of medicine is extensive, and its practitioner must first be trained in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the arrangement of the limbs, their form, the connections and separations of those parts,  the knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, their number, and their arrangement; and the knowledge of the pulsating veins and the stationary ones, and the locations of their origins.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates says that with a name alone, the subject is little, but especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction of this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said about anatomy will inevitably fall into error, for which men will die, as I have seen many such, because some are trained in this science and yet operate without it [the scientific knowledge] and without experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and unskilled physician, having incised a scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and cut some of the arteries of the neck, so that much blood flowed until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who claimed to have removed a stone from a man who had suffered long, the stone being large, and he came to him and extracted that stone with a piece of the bladder, causing the man to die on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I myself, having been called upon to remove that stone, saw that because of the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician, who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and went to a black-skinned man who had a fractured thigh.  The physician, with his ignorance, treated the fracture, placing the injury on top of cushions and bandages with excessive tightness, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he unbound him according to his desires, and then he bandaged him, and then he left him for a few days and commanded that we should loosen the bandage; and it remained like that until the thigh and foot became full of pus, and he perished.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I proceeded to loosen the bandage, and tranquillity was achieved, and he was freed from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, corruption had already set in within the limb, so that I could not halt it, and the corruption continued to spread through the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated over several days, until the severity of the condition was magnified with the patient's suffering.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which cause is that because cancerous sores are pure of melancholic humor, therefore they should not be removed by complete cauterization, but rather the affected limb should be amputated.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgical procedure be divided into two parts: one being the procedure associated with health, and the other the procedure that poses a risk in the majority of cases.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already shown this throughout this book, where there is a procedure that is error-prone and fraught with fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against this and abandon it, so that the mistakes do not find a way to speak and disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and God's protection, and your patients with kindness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best path, by God's grace, to achieve health and praiseworthy success, and abandon the terrible illnesses of difficult cure, and free your tools from that which makes you fear, so that your skill in your faith and in your name does not escape you: for more remains for your glory, and higher in the world and behind your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galen already said in some of his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a severe illness, lest you be called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered from head to feet, concerning the forms of instruments and the tools of cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of incisions and perforations, and of cupping, and of sores, and of the extraction of arrows and similar things, all chaptered and ordered by the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and dislocation, and of the treatment of twisting and similar things; a chapter ordered from head to foot, and of the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to describe the benefits of this cauterization and its harmfulness, and in which constitution cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discussion of the benefits and harm of cauterization is long and lengthy, subtle in science, and secretly hidden; and already many wise men have spoken of it, and they have disagreed about it, and for me, a small part of their discussions suffices, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cauterization is beneficial to all constitutions universally, which are with matter or without matter, except for two constitutions, which are hot constitutions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry constitution with matter, there is disagreement; for some have said that cauterization is beneficial to it, and others have said the opposite, that cauterization is not suitable in illnesses that are due to qualities and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that a hot and dry illness be cured with something that is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite argue that cauterization is beneficial in all hot and dry illnesses that affect people's bodies, because when you compare the body and its moisture to the constitution of fire, you find the body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, regarding this argument, that experience has shown me this to be true on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, this should not be accepted by someone who has not already been trained and experienced in the chapter on cauterization through prior practice, and who has not understood the variety of human constitutions, the nature of illnesses themselves, their causes, their symptoms, and the timeframes associated with them.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other constitutions, there is no fear for you, and especially in cold and humid illnesses, for all doctors have agreed upon these, and there is no disagreement on the benefit of cauterization in them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And understand, children, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire, and its effectiveness, is superior to cauterization using medicinal burning substances because fire is simple.  Its action only affects the member being cauterized and does not harm other connected members except through minor damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of medicinal burning substances spreads to those members distant from it, and easily causes severe illnesses in the affected member, making healing difficult and prolonging suffering.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, because of its purity and goodness of substance, does not do this; rather, it simply flows over.  We already know this through experiment and a long period of study of the art, understanding the truth of its causes.  Because of this, I am excused from a long discourse.  And if it were not for the fact that my book in this place, dedicated to the secrets of fire, and its effect on the body and the expulsion of illnesses, is already written (the operation of which it describes); a philosophical discourse demonstrating it, suitable for your comprehension, would be unnecessary.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And understand, children, that they disagree on the time when cauterization is most effective, and they consider springtime the best time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is appropriate at any time, because the harm caused by time is overcome by the benefit gained from the cauterization, and especially if the cauterization is for acute and sudden pains or necessary ailments, which cannot tolerate delay, because the risk of greater harm from worsening is greater than the minor harm from the passing of time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not considered by you, or, children, this is not understood by the ignorant crowd or foolish physicians; they believe that every illness treated by cauterization is not always cured, and they thus conclude this.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not as they imagine, for cauterization is a form of medicine that alters the complexion and dries up the moisture that causes the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cauterization is superior to other medicine because of its power, the efficacy of its action, and the grandeur of its effects.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness may return at some time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of the illness, their strength, and the buildup of excess fluids within them, and what they have consumed in food and similar things.  However, if the illness for which cauterization is administered is a localized ailment with few excess fluids and moisture, like toothache and similar cases, it is possible that the pain will not return, but this is in small instances.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is commonly said that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, and that is a true statement, not in the way they understand it, for they believe there is no cure that works with medicine or any other means after cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is the opposite of that; the idea that cauterization is the last resort in medicine is only true when we have tried other methods of treatment for certain illnesses, and those methods did not work, and then, at the end, one resorts to cauterization, which does help in that situation.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, the statement that cauterization is the last resort in medicine is not true according to the understanding of the common people and many foolish physicians.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they said this only because of the purity and superior nature of gold's substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the cauterized area does not heal, but this is not entirely true, for I have proven this and found that this only happens in certain bodies and not others. Cauterization with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said; however, when you cauterize with gold-heated fire, it is not clearly explained to you, because the heat is specific to the amount you want due to the gold's resilience.  And because it is prepared to accept cold, if you apply the heat, the gold melts due to the fire, and some filings fall into the fire, causing the artisan trouble because of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cauterization with iron is done more easily and more effectively for the correct execution of the procedure.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cauterization according to topics, and I have arranged those from the head down to the feet, so that the seeker may find what they want in it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for head pain caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is effective against dampness and coldness affecting the brain, the cause of which is often twofold: a chronic and profuse rheumatic flux, known as a cold, flowing from the head to the eyes and ears, and excessive sleep; it also causes toothaches and sore throats, and generally any ailment stemming from cold, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, order the patient to be purged with laxative medicine, clearing the head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and constitution.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then order him to shave his head, and then place him on a padded bench with your hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the blade of your palm near the root of his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when your middle finger has reached that spot, mark the area with a mark, and then apply the olive cautery, which is done like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that [cautery] on the marked spot, in such a way that it descends, with your hand being gradually tightened, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently lift your hand and observe the area.  If you see any significant amount of bone exposed, about the size of a grain of barley, then lift your hand.  If not, then return your hand with that iron, or another, if it has cooled, until the bone is visible as I have described to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the area, and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply a cloth soaked in broth and leave it on until the scar from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with four-drug ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if the wound remains open, the better it is to keep the arm elevated, because this is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's substance has adhered.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what has adhered to the bone, and then it should be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery they should reach the back, until it firmly presses on the bone until the bone breaks, and this is the method of a small cauterization.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that vapors from the head escape from that location.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cautery in all cases, but only in some individuals, according to a cautious approach.  And, in my view, it is better, when possible, to use a gentler treatment; for the head is weakened by a disruption of its continuity, just as we have observed in other parts of the body, especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and by using it and with that technique, it's done with care.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a chronic and prolonged pain affects the entire head of a patient who has been treated with cupping, leeches, head purges, plasters, washes, poultices, fowl and similar remedies, and especially if the previous cauterization with the method we've described has been ineffective, then consider that if the patient's head is of a strong constitution and not frail, and is experiencing intense cold, then cauterize with another cautery just below the first one slightly.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the temple of their head with a cautery until the skin is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skin open, and expose the bone to the extent described earlier, and cauterize that area on the back of the head in the area known as the "vas" (and it is the area where a cupping glass is placed).
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience a great pain, different from the pain of other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I would recommend this cautery in its place, for the cautery used for cauterizing the temples and the back of the head should be a more delicate cautery than the one used for cauterizing the middle of the head; and this is the method for it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization of non-chronic migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a sudden or widespread pain occurs in the head, or extends to the eye, the head should be cleansed with medicines, and the other cure, which I have described in the treatments of diseases, should be administered.  If this does not work, then cauterization is performed in two ways: either with a sharp, burning medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is done by taking a clove of garlic, peeling and cutting off the ends of both its heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then, using a sharp lancet, cut the painful area on the temple until you create a small, hidden cavity beneath the skin.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then, apply a compress to the area to gently constrict it, and leave it for three hours.  Then remove it and discard the garlic, and allow the wound to heal for two or three days.  Finally, apply a cloth soaked in broth to the area until it heals properly.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron, according to this method:  (or,  using fire as a cauterizing agent, the procedure is as follows:)
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a "nail-clavil," because the head of it is like a nail's shape, in which there is some curvature, and a small eminence in the middle of it.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand—so that the flesh below isn't burned—and turn the small iron slowly and quickly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that is burned by the intensity of the cautery is as much as half of it, lift your hand so the underlying artery isn't burned, to prevent bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak some cotton in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; and then apply cotton soaked in butter, and then treat with ointment until healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the blade's edge, following the cautery method, and be careful not to cut an artery in this, a properly executed, but not antiquated method.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization of chronic migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine with what we've discussed in the previous treatment, and what we've discussed in the classifications of illnesses, and the treatment doesn't work, and sometimes because the illness prevents the use of what we've described in the initial cauterization with medicine or cauterization with fire, then you must heat the knife cautery until it is white-hot, then make a line of cauterization on the site of the pain, a length equal to half a finger or less; hold your hand still once and press it until you cut the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful not to damage the continuity of the jaw, which is strained by chewing, and that the ligaments and nerves that control it, are not injured, and do not cause spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the protection and caution of the flow of blood from the severed artery, for in its severance there is danger, especially for one who doesn't understand what they're doing, is not skilled, and hasn't practiced; and leaves the procedure unfinished at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will return with a reminder of the treatment of accidental blood flow from the artery, according to its method, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this treatment doesn't help with this illness, and you see the patient's condition is tolerable, cauterize in the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have discussed in the chapter on artery constriction with a cautery having two blades; this is a better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization of earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain due to cold and it is treated with laxative remedies and the other treatments mentioned in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then apply the cautery, and this is the one called "puncta," which has this form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then apply the heated point, moving it around the entire ear in a circular motion, or in a series of small circles, if the pain is localized in specific areas.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery from the base of the ear slowly, after you have marked the location with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery touches several points in the ear, cauterize each one, and then treat the affected areas until they heal.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization of tumours.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tumours that are cured with cauterization are only of the types that arise from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type caused by dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumour with leeches, purges, and other remedies, and your treatment is unsuccessful, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, a second a little below the temple, and a third at the juncture of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for softening occurs only on the apparently healthy side.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery on the right side of the ear's extremity, a little higher than the temple, and another in the temple, whose length is equal to the length of the index finger, and hold the cautery until the size of half of the affected area is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cauterization, and it is a type of surgical procedure, the method of which is described beforehand.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than what you have seen; and it is necessary to cut away some excess fat.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what has been previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have treated it with what we have said, and you do not see improvement in the patient and the illness does not have a fever, then cauterize the area with four cauteries: on all the temples of their head; and with a cautery on the middle of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the throat.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done according to what has been previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is further behind; and it should be further treated with whatever you proceed with.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization of forgetfulness performed by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Large jars and pills that cleanse the brain should be given to the patient at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's entire head and place a plaster of the described kind, found in the treatise on plasters, upon the patient's crown.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for this is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order that I have already described.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore, if this treatment is effective, then do so; and if not, then make three cauteries on the back part of his head, extending downwards from the highest part of the head down to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place the width of a finger between each cautery, and then treat the cauterization with the previously described treatment.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add more and the patient tolerates it, then make a cautery in the middle place; and if you want a greater application, then cauterize it over the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be oiled according to the previously given form.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Concerning the cauterization of paralysis and the softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should proceed with the cleansing of the head with herbs and what we have said; then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with cautery in the middle of the head, and with cauteries on all the horns of the head, and with cautery on the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if, in the illness of softening of the body, the patient is weak and the illness is severe, then cauterize that with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and subsequently with a cautery until the body is relaxed, very loose, and then remove your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat it until it is healed, and this should be olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain of the patient at the beginning with herbs and with the other treatment that we have described in the division when the illness is great and tolerates the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate the medicines, then administer poultices and masticatories that treat the brain, beforehand for many days, with a good diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the back of the head, and cauterize above each temple.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize it with the cauteries I have mentioned, having simultaneously paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-like, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a delicate cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Concerning the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humors and thick phlegm, then cauterize it with the cauteries that we have mentioned in the previous discussion of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess leaning towards melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give them to drink that which purifies their brain, according to what has been previously stated in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then apply a properly made cauterization to the scalp, placing it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated firmly, and be held in place on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and a sheep's wool poultice is more worthy.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over a fire with a measured, moderate heat, which the said patient tolerates when applied.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle of the patient's head, on the scalp, and leave it until it has cooled down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week, along with the other treatment for him, until he is healed; or, if you wish, cauterize that area with small punctures, following the patient's tolerance, but keep your hand with a cautery instrument appropriately prepared: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cloth soaked in wool or hen's dung.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the cauterization of descending water in the eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you are informed of the beginning of water in the eye through the signs I have mentioned in the section, then begin and give the patient to drink what will modify the fluids in their head, and protect them from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that person sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command the patient to shave their head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of watery discharge in both eyes, or on one temple if the watery discharge is beginning in one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are below the forehead; and let the cauteries be at that length, in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from them, stop it with any medicine possible to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with the knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of them and the prevention of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck below two bones with two cauteries placed directly.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old sores.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the eyes are old, persistent, and evident through the veins and arteries in the exposed area of the head, and it is confirmed that this is due to cold phlegmatic superfluities, then cauterize it with the cautery we described in the chapter on beginning with hot water on the sores, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries on the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if more is needed, then cauterize that along the entire area of the eye socket over the edge of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of nasal foul odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we have described in the division and your treatment doesn't work, then you prepare and give the patient cocculus to drink for three nights; and afterward, shave the patient's head, and cauterize with a moderate cautery and an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clove cautery, using two cauteries just above the two eyebrows, slightly below the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the sparks, so you don't set it on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clove cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauteries for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its method:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize a small area above the two eyebrows with two cauteries, on all parts, and they should be positioned away from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too hard with the cautery, but only to the extent that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cautery of the eyelid when the hairs are turned inwards and prick the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are turned inward so that they prick the eye, cautery in such cases is done in two ways, either with cautery or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with cautery using fire, command the patient beforehand to remove their eyelashes as one would clean them, until they are lengthened and thinned; and if they prick the eye near their origin, then you should bind the eyes with a bandage so that they are not injured until the hairs have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, once they have grown back and thinned, place the patient's head on your lap, and then gently press against the eyelid with a probe, with a marking shaped like a myrtle leaf, and begin the marking near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place cotton soaked in egg white or in a ptilli mucilage on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, which has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the shape you have marked, little by little, many times, until the surface of the skin, which is like a myrtle leaf, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of success in your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs raised towards the puncture in the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with a border over it until the scab is removed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if, due to some cause, the hair begins to grow again and the eyelid is softened, then apply the cautery again in the same way as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are *under* the eyelid, then cauterize them until they are raised to their natural position and the wound is healed, so that the hairs don't irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	However, a cautery with a burning medicine, which is what you command the patient to do, is to allow the hairs to grow out and heal, and then a leaf-shaped piece of cloth (like a myrtle leaf) is made.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known herbs and living vinegar, or whatever that is, and mix those things well.  Do this quickly so it doesn't get cold; then spread this mixture onto the cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf. Place this on the affected eye(s). Put a cotton ball soaked in egg white under the eye. And the patient's head should be supported by you.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your fingertip on the medicine and press gently, but don't remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for it burns like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when it persists in causing a burning sensation, then remove the medicine and gently rub it off with your fingertip; when the burning stops, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; then check if the eyelid has been raised (like it has been released from the constriction by fire or incision). If so, it is well. If not, reapply the medicine to the place where it has not yet been applied and do not give up until your treatment is completed and the eye is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a cotton ball with a bandage until the burn is healed, and then treat it with a definitive ointment or something else until it is healthy.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you, in the course of your treatment, to carefully ensure that no medicine gets into the eye.  If, after a few days, the eyelid becomes softened and some of the hairs get into the eye, then reapply your medicine to the softened area of the eyelid, just as you did at the beginning, and continue treating it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of using myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And understand that human eyes vary in size and thus your treatment is adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to recovery for those studying this art should not be hidden.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods described in the divisions of diseases, and your treatment doesn't work, then you should cauterize it as follows:  Instruct the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have an assistant hold the patient's head between your hands in such a way that it is neither moved nor shaken by their head's movements.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or plant mucilage over the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, which is shaped as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave, like the shape of a reed or a vulture's wing, at the end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should be pointed towards the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it should be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one that is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and drain and dry that area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery, which is well-heated, over it, and hold it with your hand a little distance from the cautery's edge, near the nose, so that your hand does not stray or the patient is not disturbed. Then place the cautery on the sore area and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning your cautery penetrates the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then place a poultice with lint over it and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply an aggressive corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is scraped as is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier physicians said:  Open the area of the fistula and make it open, then place in that fissure a thin lead rod, which is its shape: and put in that quantity of one ounce of molten lead; and hold it with your hand firmly, so that the patient is not moved, lest the molten lead reach the eye; and it is necessary that you place on the patient's eye a poultice soaked in egg white or water, because lead adheres to the fistula area and heals it with remarkable healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a trepanation of the nose and to return the fistula to the nasal cavity to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cauterization of the fissure of the pot (or, more literally, "pit").
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures occur in the lips, and more often in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment is not effective, then heat the small, knife-like cautery according to this form that is described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its concavity should be according to the thinness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully apply that heated cautery to those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms at the base of the uvula, or on the palate, or at the roots of the teeth, and it bursts, and is old, and pus drains and a fistula is formed, and you treat it but it does not respond to treatment, then you should apply a heated cautery according to the size of the opening in the fistula, and then insert the heated cautery into the fistula opening, and hold your hand there until the heated iron reaches the bottom of it, and this is done once or twice; and then treat it with the cure we previously mentioned until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the discharge is cut off and healed, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to uncover the area and remove the corrupted bone according to what is described in its relevant chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the cauterization of teeth and the softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with remedies but it does not improve, then place the patient's head on your lap, and now apply a cautery tool whose shape is appropriate here, in such a way that you place the cautery instrument on the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it, and hold your hand there a little until the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the decayed tooth is fixed, the softened gums are tightened, and the corrupt moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On cauterization for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or there is a cold or worm in it, or you do not find a cure with medicine, then cauterize it in two ways: either with cow dung, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with cow dung involves taking cow dung, boiling it in an iron pot, then taking cotton and wrapping it around the end of a probe.  Then, dip the cotton into the boiled dung and quickly place it on the painful tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat's effect reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cotton in the aforementioned dung, place it over the aching tooth, and then place a heated iron on top of that until the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire involves using a bronze or iron probe, and making sure it is thick enough so that the heat doesn't reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery to the desired form, place it on the tooth, and hold it there until it cools; repeat this several times, as the pain may disappear either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, by pressure of that cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good dung and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize whatever extremity you are able to.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cauterization of extrophulos.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophulos are of phlegm and cold humors, and are not amenable to digestion by medicines, and you desire the digestion of them easily, then you ignite the cautery with the form of which is this following: having two open ends, so that smoke may escape from the cautery at the other end, and place that ignited one on the abscess once, and another if needed, until it reaches the bottom of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and then leave it for three days, and place on it cotton soaked in water until what the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment, bandages, and cloths until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery should be fitting for this purpose.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization for hoarseness of voice and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.
