And I have already said before, in the division, when I was discussing wounds, that any ulcer which is not healed or does not have healthy flesh, is due to one of these reasons: either due to lack of blood in the body; or due to the bad nature of the body; or because tough tissue is preventing the growth of new flesh between the affected area and the surrounding skin; or because the ulcer itself is too light; or because the material sent to the ulcer is of poor quality; or because the treatment is unsuitable; or when there is corruption in the region and it is a pestilence; or due to the nature of the region, as is the case in Saragossa, where it is difficult to digest illnesses, and the healing of the abscess is delayed by nature; or because there is a bone, or many bones, in that area.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all those causes, and the signs of those, and the treatment of them with medicines, in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And it is necessary that I make you aware of the treatment of a fistula, which is done through surgery with the hands.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all parts of the body; for there are fistulas that reach major veins and arteries, or nerves, or the spinal cord, or the intestine, or the bladder, or to one of the ribs, or to any of the vertebrae of the spine, or to any of the joints formed by this connection, such as the hand and foot; and those that are close to the main part of the limb and similar ones.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	Therefore, those fistulas of this type are among the illnesses with difficult healing, and they do not receive cure, and working on them is a waste of effort and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if any of the fistulas is not deep to the areas I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its cure, and wish to gain knowledge of it, then take a probe or iron, and if the fistula goes straight, and you seek it out with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is winding, then investigate it with a probe of fine lead, for lead, with the lightness of its body, is easily guided and curved towards the winding path.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has many orifices, it is not possible for you to locate them with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then irrigate the orifices with their orifices, for the moisture with which you irrigate it goes toward the other orifices and runs through them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire meticulously, by what means you can ascertain if there are bones or nerves, and whether the cavity of the fistula is distant or close, or if it is a fistula with many orifices and is all about this, with the utmost of your strength, with your questioning, with which you question the patient, and the location of the pain by your pressing with your hand on the area, and similar to the meanings and accidental causes of an abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all those matters with true judgment, then proceed to the cure according to your confidence;  and you should consider whether the fistula is a superficial, close, or exposed fistula; or in a salty place; distant from a joint, or nerve, or artery, or vein, or one of the places that I have told you about.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you should dry the fistula as previously described in the narration, and remove that which is in that filtration and putrid flesh, and that which has grown in the opening of the flesh, or of the boil and the like, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	However, if the fistula is of deep origin, and is of a severe nature, then it is necessary to incise it at its depth as much as possible for you, and then clean it of all its putrid flesh; and then administer some wraps in sharp medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have grasped with iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this repeatedly until the sharp medicine corrodes everything that remains in the fistula's cavity of corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments that generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then you cauterize it as we have recounted.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	However, if the cause of the fistula is bone, and you are certain of this, then you investigate it and dry it as we have recounted, if you do not find any cause of a vein, nerve, or a major limb in it, as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is any corruption or blackness on it, then you scrape it until all the corruption is removed; and then treat it with something that promotes flesh growth until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and still discharges pus, as before, then know that you have not achieved complete eradication of the corruption; and then you open it up again more carefully, thoroughly scrape it and cleanse it with your most powerful tools, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so, if it is healed, it is good; but if not, then know that the corruption lies in the distant depths of the body, which has not been reached, and so there is no remedy but to leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is possible for you to remove it, then you remove it with delicate forceps suitable for this.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully remove all of them, and leave nothing behind with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if some difficulty arises from the humors, and in their incision there is no fear or error, then cut through those ligaments or flesh if they are there, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if there is no preparation to remove the bones at your hour, then apply to the wound something that can hold the wound, and leave it until it is about the bones, the flesh, and the ligaments, and keep the wound from becoming consolidated, and make the incision you have made in your operation constricted.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Furthermore, if you are afraid, apply to it cotton soaked in heated oil, or cotton soaked in Egyptian ointment, or in any of the green ointments, because when those ligaments soften, and the bones are separated from them, the removal and extraction of them is eased.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	However, if it is a large bone, like a leg bone or thigh bone or similar to those, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then scrape it with a rasp only from behind until that blackness and corruption is removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	However, if the corrupted part is large, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and cut entirely to the place where the corruption has reached, and then treat it until it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recount to you what happened to a man in his thigh, so that you may use it as an example and aid in your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was a young man, around 30 years old, who experienced pain in his thigh, and the matter (disease) from within the body had spread to the thigh, and it was a matter of a large abscess, and it was not an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the condition was prolonged by the error of the physicians until the abscess opened, and many materials (pus) escaped, and its cure was delayed until the leg was fistulous, and many orifices were created in it, all of which discharged pus and the body's humidities.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then a multitude of physicians treated him for about two years, and none of them were skilled in the art, until I was called upon.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the materials that flowed from those orifices in large quantities; and the man's body was already emaciated, and his complexion was yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted a probe into one of those orifices, and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I probed all the orifices and found that they led to every part of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I cut and incised on one of those orifices until I exposed part of the bone, and found it corrupted, already decayed and blackened; and a part of the leg was already corrupted, having penetrated into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I closed what had been exposed and prepared of the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I judged that it was not in the bone, but that corruption which I had incised and closed, and I had already extracted it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I applied restorative medicines to the wound for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I reopened and exposed the bone a second time over the first exposure, and found continuous corruption within the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I closed what appeared to me of that corruption, and then I was forced to perform the healing and restoration of it, and it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I uncovered it again and did not cease to dissect the bone little by little, specifically, forcing its restoration, and it was not restored until I incised it around a palm's width, and extracted it with its marrow.  Then I restored that with medicines, and it was slightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And no further repetition in the operation and sectioning of it is necessary except for the weakness of the patient, and the patient's low tolerance and fear of death, for the patient had fainting spells at all hours due to excessive evacuation, a bad syncope.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so it was healed entirely, and there was no soft flesh in the place of the bone; and its condition within the body was good, and its strength returned; and it was restored to its original condition, and it caused no difficulty in walking or harm in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is protruding from its place in the body, then you should section it in this way:  You should take a bandage and tighten it at the end of the protruding bone, and order someone to extend that outward; and place a thicker woolen bandage over the first bandage; and then bind it over the flesh beneath the bone, and extend the end of the bandage to pull the flesh back into its place, and you should uncover the flesh in the area you wish to cut so that the cutting doesn't harm the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a stick or board under the bone properly, for when you do this, the cut is not prohibited from severing the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And the incision should be made on the corrupted area little by little, because if the corruption is in the hollow of the bone and not apparent to the senses, it will need to be incised again.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not protruding, with one part continuing into the other, and the corruption is in the middle or a part of it, then you should uncover all the flesh; then place a stick underneath, and then cut along the first part where the corruption is until the incision continues to the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the incision be along the area of the corruption, a little bit at a time, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut that corrupted joint, and cut the bone where it is continuous with the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not a reasoned thing but rather an unnatural process.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or sole of the foot, it is very difficult; however, you must investigate the corruption in whatever way appears to you, and cut and cleanse it according to every possible method, and by any means rectify it, as long as it doesn't injure any vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the incisions and saws to cut these bones are very specific to the placement of the bones, their preparation, their thickness, their subtlety, size, and smallness, and their hardness and rarity.  Therefore, you must prepare instruments appropriate to every type of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation indicates to you the type of instrument you need; when you have great study, long experience, and knowledge of the methods of this art, and experience with the nature of illnesses, then you yourself will already know what instruments are appropriate for each illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I am now providing you, at the end of this chapter, a list of the instruments you will use, along with simple instructions, for your procedures, which you will test on others.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of ray:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this ray be in the shape of a star-shaped key head, and its points be in the shape of the points of an alstefegi.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not fitting except that with that [the ray], the heads of the joints be rubbed when they are corrupted, or the mouth [of the joint] is large and wide.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a larger razor than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a lateral razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Shape of another well-made saw:  Its arch should be made higher, and its cutting edge should be of iron, and its handle of well-made wood.
Forma de lu:	Shape of it:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor that has a concavity:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Shape of another very thin razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved end:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor resembling a tentacle:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of a tool with which bones are cut:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another smaller cutting tool:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another cutting tool; this one resembling a ray, and its end is like a saw, and it is found in many places in the treatment of bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a ray which is appropriate for the treatment of a bone that has been perforated:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its end is triangular and has a sharp tip.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly, all the things we have described about razors, cutting tools, and saws should be.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the cutting edges and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be damaged either by an internal or external cause, or if your treatment with these medicines does not improve the condition, or sometimes the damage moves towards the limb not affected by any cause.  Then, you must cut into that limb, up to where the damage has spread, to make sure the patient is saved from death or severe injury, which is a greater harm to the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of the affected area is that the limb becomes black, as if a fire has already burned it, or the blackness can spread until the hardness affects that limb and the entire body; and therefore cut it with a surgical incision.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the cause of the damage is a blow from venomous things, such as a scorpion, a viper, or a weasel, and similar creatures.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the damage or injury is in the extremity of the finger, then you cut the finger and do not allow the damage to spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if the damage reaches the hand, then you cut the hand from the base of the wrist, and do not allow the damage to spread to the arm's socket.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if, instead, it affects that area, then cut the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the damage goes beyond the elbow, then in that case, death of the patient is certain; and administering any other remedy for this is a waste of effort.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, do the same for the foot. When the damage reaches the toe of the foot, then you cut it down to one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it spreads to the sole of the foot, then you cut off the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it goes up to the knee, then you cut the leg up to the knee joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the damage has already reached the knee, then there is no cure for him but to let him go, and leave the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way to cut or sever the limb is to tighten the ligament in the part below where you want to cut, and tighten another ligament over the spot; and the surgeon should extend a ligament to the lower parts, and extend another ligament upwards; and you separate the flesh that is between the two ligaments with a wide blade until all the flesh is exposed; and then it should be cut or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to place cloths around all parts so that the wound does not touch anything, and that the patient receives a well-fitted and carefully treated abscess.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if you cause a flow of blood when you operate, then you cauterize the wounded area carefully, or put some blood-stopping powders on it; and then return to your treatment until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the injured limb with a suitable bandage, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I relate to you what happened to a man on his foot, this same accident which I and you have discussed, which is that he got a blackening on his foot with a burn that resembled a fire's combustion.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first occurred in his toe until it spread to the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then the man himself prepared, because he saw the healing of the limb proceed with the intensity of what he felt in pain and burning, and he incised that foot down to the joint, and was healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	That same corruption happened to him for a long time in the index finger of his hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I was compelled to counteract that excess with what I could place on his hand, to cleanse his body; but the excess was not repelled, and it began to spread to the other fingers until it began to affect his whole hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he urged me to cut his hand, but I did not want to do this, hoping for the expulsion of that excess, and fearing that the incision of his hand might cause his death, for the patient's strength was at its lowest ebb.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his land, and word reached me that the man prepared himself and incised his whole hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not related this story except to be of help in understanding this disease, and that it might serve as a sign by which it is recognized and treated according to its nature.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of sinuses and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs on a fleshy part of the body and the space of the abscess has enlarged to collect pus, and it has been broken and perforated, and pus has been discharged, leaving the area empty like a vessel, and the skin over it is thin like a fine cloth, and it has not progressed to deeper corruption, and has not affected the bone, nerves, or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space has enlarged to the point that the corruption has spread to another part of the body, then it is called a fistula, and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is to cut through that skin completely, just as it is involved, especially if it is thin and like a cloth, and make sure that it does not adhere to the area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you expect the skin to adhere and that corruption has not yet spread deeper, and the skin has an opening on the surface, then treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider it a sinus, and if it is large, and the discharge has a foul odor, then irrigate it with an Egyptian medicine, which is made of oil, vinegar, and honey in equal parts, mixed in a vessel and heated over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and resembles honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take what is necessary from it and dissolve it with water and honey; and irrigate the sinus with that, and constrict its opening, and leave the medicine there for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then extract that with a sponge; and do this for as many days as are necessary until the sinus is cleansed and the foul odor is gone.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is irrigated with ash water, when this medicine is not available to you; and you should take the ash of wood, and pour water over it; then filter that and irrigate the sinus with it until you are confident that the sinus is now closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the ash water, then irrigate it with water and honey, and add crushed herbs.  Or, irrigate it with wine and honey mixed, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and wine causes the sinus to adhere, especially when the wine contains an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and are confident that the sinus is already healed, then irrigate it with something that promotes the growth of flesh there.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take diafinicon ointment and dissolve it with warmed oil and astringent wine; or irrigate it with other medicines and ointments that have the properties I have already described in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow, preventing the enema tube from entering, then gradually widen it with a small iron, and place warm, Egyptian or basil ointment there, until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is wide, then you should bring the lips together with sutures, leaving just enough room for the enema tube to enter without difficulty.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the fistula comes out is elevated to the upper parts, then you should dissect it down to the lowest point possible, so that the fistula runs downwards, for when the fistula is obstructed deep inside the sinus, the flesh will grow there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dissect the sinus to the lowest bone as desired, then you must prepare the affected limb with a method that allows the fistula to drain slightly, according to what is appropriate for you, and that nothing is obstructing the fistula's passage.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are appropriate for this, placing them on a cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be large enough to cover the entire sinus opening; then, using scissors, cut a slightly wider opening directly next to the sinus opening; next, spread a layer of ointments, appropriate to the size of the cut, onto another cloth, and place it over the area, ensuring that it's some distance from the sinus opening, to facilitate the fistula's drainage.  Remove the large cloth only after a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the sinus opening, must remain in place at all times, to prevent anything that is causing the fistula from coming out.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what is draining from the fistula is much or little, or is digested, or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And by this, consider the location of the sinus, whether the patient feels pain there, and if there is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment has continued in this way, and you see the matter discharged over the sinus opening is beginning to adhere or stick, then on the third day, loosen it, and when you loosen the scab, then change the cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus a subtle, thin virus has spread, then do not despair of the adhesion of it, for healing of it is on its way, for there are some people in whom the generation of flesh in their wounds is slow, and in others, the opposite is true.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus for many days undigested matter has come out, then know that the sinus will not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you should adjust the medicines towards drying, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and their virtue, they become dry like a diafinicon ointment, when in it a superfluity of zegi (a type of medicinal ingredient) has been added.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The final advice for healing is to take diafinicon ointment, dissolve it in rose oil, and add old wine to it, in its substance, and then mix it thoroughly, and use that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And similarly in this treatment, if there is no matter, use diafinicon ointment, or honey when it is cooked until thick, and apply it; or take myrrh, aloe, and frankincense, grind them all into powder, and sprinkle them over the honey while it is on the fire.  Then spread this mixture on a cloth and press it onto the sinus; or apply the thick, cooked honey to a cloth and press that onto the sinus.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes, aristolochia longa, roots of lilies (and it is *lilium celesti*), and the powder of eryngo and centaury are administered.  Grind and sift these ingredients, and mix them into the honey I have previously described. Use this mixture.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, then know that the corruption is in the bone or other hard members, or in the ligaments. Then you should treat it with a fistulous cure, as described above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of whitlow, and of a bruised nail, and the incision of a swollen finger, and the cutting.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Whitlow is an abscess that arises beneath the nail of a finger or toe, and frequently arises on other fingers.  If it is prolonged and its cure is less likely, or is an abscess of a hot abscess, or is corrupt, it will produce matter until it eats away the base of the nail, and often entirely corrupts it, and often spreads its corruption to the bone until it has a foul odor, the end of the finger is blackened, and its colour is dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore, when you have done as we have said in the division and your treatment does not succeed, you should cut away all the excess flesh remaining around the nail with an iron and then cauterize the wound with that, for cautery is very helpful in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the nail's appendages have already begun to press on the flesh inside, and start to prick and irritate it, then you should place a thin strip under the edge of the nail that is pricking the flesh, and push that flesh up and cut it easily, and apply the remaining flesh with burning, corrosive medicines until everything is removed. Then treat the area with ointments until it heals.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you must cut into and remove that bone, for a bone that is corrupted will never heal.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the erosion and corruption have spread to the finger, then cut it at one of its joints, according to the anticipated restoration, and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail has suffered blows or friction, and there is intense pain, you must first bleed the patient, then dry the nail with a sharp lancet in a transverse cut from top to bottom, and be careful not to cut into the flesh under the nail, as you will cause the patient intense pain, and will cause the excessive inflamed flesh to grow in the area. Then treat the area with whatever soothes the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	However, a swollen finger, which is found in some men's hands, is easily fleshy, and is easily found in the bones, or is easily found in the nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the base of the joint, or their origin is in some of the finger's joints.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in some joints of the finger is not harmful, and that which is born in the joints is easily inflamed.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are fleshy growths, the incision is gentle, and you should cut into that from its base with a broad lancet.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for that which is born at the base of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of the excision of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But for that which is born on the finger at the joints, you should first cut the flesh around it in a circular incision down to the bone, then use a suitable saw to sever it, and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But if the fingers become fused together, either by the nature of the person's birth, or due to a wound, burn, or similar cause, then it is necessary to separate that fusion until the fingers return to their natural shape.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place linen strips soaked in warm oil between them to prevent them from fusing together, and separate them or put a thin lead plate between them until they are properly healed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if fusion occurs between any finger and the palm, then you should separate that fusion according to the appropriate preparation and the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Concerning the cutting of varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are large, twisted veins filled with melancholic excess that appear on various parts of the body, most frequently in the legs, especially in the legs of travelers, laborers, and those who carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then it is necessary that you administer a purge of black bile from the body several times with a strong expulsion, and afterward, bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	However, the cure for them with iron is according to two methods: one is that they are incised and the black blood is drawn out, and the other method is that the vein is raised and entirely extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The cutting of it is done in this manner: first, soak the leg in very hot water until the thick, phlegmy blood in the leg is resolved; then, firmly bind the patient's leg from just above the knee to below the knee with a bandage; next, cut the vein in one, two, or three places with a wide incision; then, lift the black blood with your hand from the lower part of the leg upwards, and downwards, until the desired amount of blood has been drawn out, which will reduce the power of the ailment.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bandage it, and order the patient to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are filled, and this is useful to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the raising of them is done in this way: you raise the patient's leg, if it is very hairy, and then place them in a bath and soak the leg in hot water until it turns red and the veins are prominent; or, if a bath is not available, it is done by vigorous exercise until the limb is warmed.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the cord along the vein, either lengthwise or behind the knee, or just below the heel.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the cord with hooks and scrape the vein from all sides until it appears, and it is near the appearance of that redness changing to blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then, as you empty it, you see from the cord that white thread which is a string.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you put a ray under that [the string] so that it is raised and pulled away from the cord, and suspend it with a hook or a lion's claw.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then make another incision near that incision, after three days, and then scrape the cord on the part above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then raise it and cut it in a posterior incision toward the heel, and then extract it and raise it until it is out through the second incision, and then extract it from the incision above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract it from the incision that is highest or most superior of all the incisions, until all of it is out; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you are unable to extract and elevate it, then insert a needle with a strong double thread and tie it and pull it out, or insert a stick/rod under it and turn your hand around in every direction until it is thrown out.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; for if it is broken, it will be difficult for you to elevate it and it will have caused harm to the patient.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all of it has been expelled, then place on the affected area wool soaked in mixed oil and unmixed oil, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is constricted, having tortuosity to which it is wrapped in parts, and is not straight as we have said, then you must cut along every part of its tortuosity and in the places where it is wrapped, and then suspend it with hooks until you have elevated it entirely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful in your incision not to cut the vein and not to harm it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incision with which the vein is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of a hook or forceps:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not sharp like the hooks, nor does it have a sharp tip so as not to damage the vein; and it is of great flexibility, like a lion's, because if it were delicate, it would cut the vein due to its thinness; it therefore has an excess of thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot lands, like in the land of the Arabs and in the hot, arid lands of India, where there is little moisture and in which no grass or tree grows.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is easily generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is from putrefaction that arises under the skin, like when snakes, worms, and grubs, and worms that breed between the skin and the flesh, enter the body.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the onset of this condition is a violent inflammation in the leg where the vein occurs;  then the area becomes blistered;  and then the vein begins to emerge from the blister area, appearing as a sprout or plant root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when its extremity appears, then it is necessary to wrap a lead weight of one drachma (or two drachmas) around that area and bind it to the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as any cause of this appears on the outward parts, wrap it in lead and bind it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is prolonged, then you should cut off a part of it and wrap the remaining part; and do not cut that part off by the root until it has come out, for if you cut it by the root, it contracts and enters the flesh, causing abscesses and deep ulceration in the area.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it must be treated gently and extracted little by little, until it is expelled from the body, and no trace of it remains within.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, there have been cases of it growing to five palms and ten fingers in length, and it has been reported to me that one grew to twenty palms in length.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during its treatment, then insert a probe into the wound and perforate it with a long probe, until everything within the matter is evacuated. Then apply putrefaction-reducing remedies to the area for several days.  Afterwards, treat it as one would an abscess.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears near the joint of the foot or on the foot itself.  It has multiple openings, and from each opening sprouts a branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat it in the same way as we have described in the division and with the aforementioned methods.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Concerning the incision of worms generated under the skin, and it is called the bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called "bovine disease" in some lands near us, because it often affects cattle.  It is a small worm which is born between the skin and flesh, and it travels throughout the body, ascending and descending, manifesting itself in the patient's limbs until it breaks through the skin and exits.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, just as worms, serpents, maggots, and ascarids are produced in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its malice, for when it travels through the body and ascends to the head, and reaches the eye, it frequently causes a severe inflammation there and enters, destroying the eye.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore, when you wish to cure it and extract it, it can only be done according to its movement and appearance as perceived, and then you must tightly bind and constrict that which is above it and that which is below it, and then you should cut open the skin over it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and you do not find it, then you apply a cautery with fire to the area until it dies, and the most feared consequence is the putrefaction of it, which corrupts the area as we have stated.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that creature has reached the head, near the eye, then tightly bind above the eyebrow with strong constriction, and then cut open the skin over it and extract it.  The patient should use medicines to cleanse their body of bad, putrid humors, and avoid foods that produce putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section concerning the illness of the nose.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called "nafir" in our land, and it is a pain that comes upon certain limbs, and then it moves from one limb to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that, as I will tell you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I examined her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein near the arm's elbow, and after an hour, I saw that inflammation moving like a worm ascending, but more quickly than a worm would, like liquid silver moving from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain moved to that location and settled into the muscle, and then I stayed there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it moved to the other arm until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I observed that it was moving throughout her body as I saw; and I was very amazed by its movement from one limb to another and the speed of this movement.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this before with my own eyes in this way, although I have seen many cases where pain moves from limb to limb.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this with my eyes in this way as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not consider it to be anything else than this, because the woman was old, with dry body and exposed veins, and in this condition, this windy sensation appeared and moved.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this type of reaction does not appear in those who are delicate and with moist bodies and hidden veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you want to treat him, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent to your eyes as we have said, so you gently and lightly press on the area until this trapped wind leaves, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your eyes, then you treat that with remedies for the body and with those that expel winds, and cure them with stinky pills and with pills of serpent and similar remedies.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to their types, and according to the places of the body where they strike, for their diversity is that of those with large points, and small, and concave, and blunt, that is, solid; and of those that have three angles, and of those that have tongues; and of those that have fins.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and parts where it strikes is in two ways: for the members, or are principal parts, such as the brain, the heart, and the liver, and the lungs, and the kidneys, and the intestines, and the bladder, and their like; and therefore, when it strikes any of these members and you see signs of death, the cause of which I shall explain shortly, then you must avoid extraction of that arrow in those in whom death is most likely, and when these bad signs do not appear to you, and the arrow is not hidden deep within the member, then you extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of the brain are when an arrow strikes it, and pierces the bone, and exits from the skull which is above the brain, for it causes sudden violent pain, and scotoma (blindness), and dizziness, and redness in the eyes, and inflammation and redness of the tongue, and spasms and confusion of thought and vomiting of bile, and the voice is often lost and the voice is destroyed, and white moisture resembling dust comes out from the wound, and the area looks like the flesh is rotting.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore, if you see these signs, then you abstain from treatment and from extracting the arrow, unless it is on the outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrow striking the heart, are that it is near the left breast, and feels as if it were lodged in a hard, not hollow, substance; and quickly the arrow's movement is like the movement of the pulse, and black blood flows from the wound, and the extremities become cold, and there is cold sweat, and fainting; and thus you know that death is certain without any doubt.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has struck the lung are the expelling of frothy blood from the wound, and the vessels near the neck become inflamed, and the patient's complexion changes, and the patient breathes with great difficulty, and seeks a draught of cool air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the membrane that is in the feet, the pain will be near the small ribs, and there is great suffering with violent pain and sighing, and all the muscles throughout the limbs are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then quickly there is vomiting of undigested food from the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow strikes the abdomen, and is lodged there, there is either a wound of the intestines, or the stomach, or a rupture of the intestines.  There is no hope of a cure if the arrow is not extracted.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow strikes the bladder, and urine leaks outside, and there is some cause for it to flow out, and there is sudden pain on the patient, then know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	However, other limbs, such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, back, vertebrae, ribs, hips, legs, and similar parts of the body, are saved depending on the greater disposition [of the patient] when the arrow does not hit a vein or artery, and is not a poisoned arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will tell you this, what I have seen regarding these arrows, so that you can consider this in your treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which is why, in a man, an arrow struck the tear duct in his nasal cavity, and I extracted it from the other side, below the ear, and he was healed, and no harm came to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew, which struck him in the region of his eye, below the lower eyelid, and the arrow was already buried, and only a small part of it was retrieved, with which I adhered to its shaft.  It was a large, pointed arrow, like those of the sharp-shooting Turks, with a lion's head on the tip, and lacking fletching.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew was healed, and no harm came to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man, which had lodged in his throat.  It was an Arab arrow, and it was the kind with fletching.  I then incised above it, between two tendons, and it was already submerged in his throat.  I then carefully worked around it, and extracted it. The Christian was healed.
