E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is excessive, then sprinkle crushed vitriol, or other similar styptic substances, upon it until the blood is stopped; or place the roasted halves of beans on the area, and leave them until the beans adhere to the area, and the blood will stop.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, repeat the application of leeches, when possible changing them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from being used, then rub the area with fresh blood or prick the area with a needle until blood flows; and then place them, for when they sense blood, they will immediately attach.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, sprinkle a little crushed alum, or salt, or ash, on them, and they will detach immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the treatment of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the restoration of fractures and dislocations of the bones that occur by accident.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	O, son, know that foolish and common physicians, and those who have never studied the books of the Ancients or read a single letter from them, boast of this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this method of learned men in our land is hidden; and I have not forgotten any of it, nor have I embraced it hastily.  Instead, I have acquired it through the lengthy study of ancient books and the intense examination of their understanding, until I extracted this knowledge from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And subsequently I have applied myself to experiment and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that my knowledge contains and upon which my experience has been applied; since I have abridged this for you and freed it from lengthy explanations; and I have condensed it to the very end of the summary; and I have shown it at the conclusion of the explanation; and I have presented various forms of the instruments used in it, as is done by adding explanations, just as I did in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of the essential elements of bone fractures, before we begin to discuss the repair of fractured limbs and their various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us begin this chapter with a summary of the subject matter; and the chapters, which the craftsman must understand at the beginning and stand upon the truth of these, that is, you and those who are eager to learn or learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore, I say that when a fracture, dislocation, twisting, or fall occurs, then you should begin with phlebotomy or alleviation, or both together, if no reason prevents it, such as weakness of constitution, or if the victim is a child, or an old person in decrepitude, or if the time is one of extreme heat or extreme cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And afterward, let his diet consist of cool herbs and the flesh of birds and rabbits; and avoid fatty meats and foods that fill the veins with blood, until you are certain of a healthy abscess and if you do not fear the outflow of matter to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then, restore the patient to his former regimen, with which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore, when the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient should be fed nourishing foods, substantial and heavy, which have viscosity, such as foods made from cooked wheat with water, and rice, and porridge, and calves' feet and belly, and eggs, and fresh fish, and thick wine and similar to these, and with this regimen, the fracture is more easily and better coagulated.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that broken bones in those who are in the prime of life and in the aged, cannot be joined and consolidated according to their nature because of the wasting of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And those are consolidated and joined according to their nature at all times due to the drying of those limbs;  and those that are theirs at the end of youth (or, literally, "softness") are also joined and consolidated, like the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nevertheless, nature joins and brings together over the broken bone some substance similar to glue, which is thick and adheres to and tightens it until it is completely glued and bound together, until it reaches the point of strength and firmness, like a fire at the beginning, until nothing hinders it from its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary that the patient eats foods that are heavy, viscous, and thick, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Different fractures according to the different members (or parts of the body).
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the leg bone is different from a fracture of the skull bone; and the fracture of the foot bone is different from the fracture of the arm bone; and similarly, all the other limbs are different from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come with a reminder of every type of fracture, explained in its own distinct chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is diverse types of fractures within themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fractures themselves are diverse; for there is a curved fracture, and those that occur in a star-like pattern; and sometimes a fracture runs along the length of the bone: and these are the fractures of the bone, jagged, and splintered, and compound and incomplete, just as happens when a writing pen is prepared, and there is a fracture with a break and a crack in the head, and there is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for every type, there is a particular method or treatment for restoring it, according to the distinct memory of it in its proper places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Various signs of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by these things is a bone fracture known:  its twisting, and the prominence and appearance of it to the sense, and that of it when you press it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	Therefore, when there is no apparent twisting in the place, nor is it made apparent by your touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not experience great pain, then there is no fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible there might be a twisting or small crack, so you should not waste your effort pressing on it with your hand and a full compression.  Instead, put on some of the medicines that bring memory to that moment, which are suited to that place, and then carefully bind it with a subtle bandage.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the place is bent but not split in two, or otherwise damaged in its arrangement, and when all parts of it remain in their position, then it is necessary for you to begin straightening it immediately, for fear of a harmful abscess occurring there.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an abscess forms there, then leave it for a few days until the abscess subsides; and then heal it in any way you can with gentleness and ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that restoring and healing the soft tissues is easier than the bone in which damage has occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to the memory of the method.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is damaged, then it is necessary to extend that broken limb in two parts, if it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two cords, or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be careful in positioning the limb back in its natural shape, while the broken limb parts are extended, then you must make every effort to return those additions to their proper places with ingenuity and in any way you can.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself from causing further pain or injury to the patient during your treatment; and endeavor, using your skill, to apply one bone to its corresponding partner according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is necessary that at that time you skillfully touch that [bone] with your hand, and if you find any other reason, then correct that and make it even according to your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive stretching and compression, as some foolish doctors, who often cause abscesses and contractions in the limb through their treatment, have been observed to do.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then, proceed to carefully adjust and properly treat and bind that limb, and provide rest and tranquility; instruct the patient about this and make him avoid moving it during his waking hours and sleep, and observe his movements and restlessness, and monitor all his actions with all your skill; and ensure that the limb's position is one that relieves pain, because when the position of the limb causes pain or injury, then it's necessary to change it to another position where there is no pain; and ensure that this position is straight and even, so that the limb does not become distorted when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The type of binding for the immobilized limb is what I recommend; so that you understand that broken limbs vary in their smallness and largeness and in their shape.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm, finger, or foot, and similar parts, then the wrapping should be of a thin, soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	However, for those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, a strong and firm wrapping is needed, for a firm bandage connects the large limb, tightening it all around, so that no gap remains.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then, proceed with applying suitable bandages to the fracture site, using three or four wraps, depending on the limb's needs; and slightly tighten the bandage with your hand.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then move to the highest part of the fracture site, and tighten less than you did at the fracture site.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then slowly loosen the wrapping of the fracture site, gradually relaxing the tightening, until you have pulled a significant part of the limb back into place.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken area with a wrap, and then move the wraps to the lowest part of the fracture; and your procedure should consist of tightening the bandage and loosening it, following the method described for the first wrap above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the wraps a pad of linen or cloth to address any twisting of the fracture, if there is any twisting; otherwise, do not place anything there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage over these carefully applied wraps, if there is no inflammation or festering sore in the area; otherwise, apply something to soothe the sore and reduce the swelling; leave that on for several days; and then tighten the wraps over that.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the splints should be made from half of a sturdy, well-shaped branch, or of pinewood, or palm fronds; and the width of each splint should be in this shape and form:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the splint placed over the fracture should be slightly larger and wider than the others, and the splint's length should match the limb's size; and then tighten the splints with another bandage according to your initial tightening; and then tie it securely above that, as previously described for tightening, and your tightening should be firmer closer to the fracture site, and the further you move from the fracture, the looser the tightening should be.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And the threads should be medium in thickness and fineness, and made of linen; and if the threads are too thick, as I have seen some foolish surgeons use, using ropes or thick twisted threads, that is a big error, as the tightening will lack uniformity.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And similarly, very thin threads are not suitable, because you will not be able to tighten them as you would like, and there should be at least a finger's width between the splints.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is irritated by the edges of the splints near the tightening, at the affected areas, then put some soft material like wool or soft linen under them, to prevent injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes the fracture is accompanied by a wound, and a disruption of the continuity occurs; and I will discuss that in more detail in the second chapter.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken limb should be fastened with splints on the first day; for, if the limb is large, you should not apply splints until perhaps 3, 5, or more days have passed, depending on your judgment about the possibility of a hot abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of plasters with which the ancients treated fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	A common method of plaster for fracture repair, suitable for many complexions, especially women and children, because it neither causes heat nor cold: take powdered flour, specifically the fine flour that collects on the inside walls of the mill after grinding.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And prepare it just as it is, but sift it with egg white, and make a paste of it that is neither thick nor thin; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of plaster for treating fractures, dislocations, and sprains: take asafoetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and wild carrot root (which is the herb called "mignar"), all 1/4 ounce each.  Myrrh and aloe, 1/8 ounce each; aloes, 1/2 ounce; all ground and sifted, and mixed with warm water or egg white if the patient's constitution is heated. Then use this plaster, for it is a good composition, healing slight fractures, and beneficial to many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of plaster, useful for fractures and sprains: take wild carrot (migrach) and white marshmallow root, 1/4 ounce each; myrrh and aloe, 1/8 ounce each; acacia, 1/6 ounce; and Armenian bole, 1/2 ounce.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are ground finely in a mortar, sifted, and mixed with water or egg white, and then applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of plaster for joints and bones separated from their places, and for pain and cracks and fractures: take wool, soak it in sour wine and boiled oil, and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	However, this plaster does not have the virtue of restoring, but rather provides a hot poultice to expel pain effectively.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of plaster to restore a broken bone: take leaves of wild fig and leaves of wild poppy;  mix them together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A quick plaster method, used for the restoration of broken bones and when you want to resolve remaining pus: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile, violet flowers, and yarrow flour, all in equal parts; grind all together and mix with wine, unless the affected area is inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	However, if it is inflamed, then treat it with damp coriander water or water and use that.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another, stronger plaster for resolving stubborn pus before the limb is restored: take roots of marshmallow, flax seeds, balms, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all in equal parts; grind everything together and mix with willow water, fresh water, or wine, depending on the limb's condition and the color of its complexion.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates in his book does not say that a plaster should be placed on the broken limb during its restoration, but rather a cerot (plaster) made of wax and oil, and nothing else;  he recommends it to be of medium thickness, neither too thick nor too thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	However, in Gaul, it is seen that plasters are placed on the broken limb during restoration, and in cases where there is drying out with a little warmth, such as myrrh, incense, and similar substances to those we have mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A plaster for healing wounds and pain: take equal parts of crushed figs, human skin (or bird's skin), marshmallow, and salt; grind and sieve them, then mix to form a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	However, regarding the amount of time the bandage should remain in place and when it should be removed, consider whether the injury causes pain, swelling or if the bone is broken and displaced.  If not, then you should not remove it for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if the area experiences intense pain, swelling, or inflammation, then you should remove or loosen the bandage immediately and remove the plaster from the area.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a clean cloth and a wet sponge, soak it in lukewarm water, and wash the area with it until the swelling subsides and the pain is eased.  Then, let the limb rest for an hour, and afterwards place a layer of wool soaked in vinegar and oil or rubbed oil on top, and bandage it for a night until you are certain of any heat or inflammation in the limb, and the pain is reduced.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a thin layer of this plaster again, and a small plaster, and do not apply the first constriction tightly; use a subtle approach until healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess, stiffness, pain, inflammation, and all the symptoms have completely subsided, and you no longer need the plaster and bandage, then you should reapply them in the same manner as you did initially.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no symptoms of those we have mentioned appear in the limb, then do not loosen the bandage for three, four, five, or seven days; and sometimes this is left on for twenty days, as you deem suitable based on the healing of the limb, as we have described, until the fracture adheres, and the flesh around it consolidates.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	Then, increase the tightness of the bandage more than in your initial application, and increase the patient's intake of nourishing food, according to the patient's recovery.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you find the fracture site is becoming too dry and weakened, more than is appropriate, know that nourishment will not reach it.  Therefore, moisten it with warm water every time you loosen the bandage, for three days.  Ease the bandage a little, and through this action, nourishment flows to the limb, and it heals quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	However, what those foolish healers do, restoring the fractured limb a second time when it was not properly restored at first, according to what is required, but rather restored in a crooked manner, is a mistake in their procedure, and great folly.  If they had done it correctly, the ancients in their writings would have explained it, and would have practiced it correctly.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, which makes it more reasonable that it should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Second Chapter: Concerning fractures when they occur to the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are numerous, and their shapes are diverse, and their causes are distinct, for some fractures are caused by a blow from a blunt instrument, and the blow crushes the entire bone down to the skull, just as it does in a log, and thus this type is called a comminuted fracture; or the blunt instrument cuts a portion of the bone and cuts the flesh on it, and does not pass through to the back of it; and this type of fracture is called a simple fracture.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the severity of these two fractures is either great or slight, and a fracture that is a crushing or grinding; and its cause is a blow with a stone or falling on a stone, and similar things.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, approaching the membrane beneath the bone, or is on the surface of the bone, and the severity of these two fractures is either great or slight.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is a fracture that is hidden within the bone, in the fineness of a small hair, and therefore this type is called a capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And a fracture is caused either by falling or by a blow from a stone, and similar things, that causes some plate of the bone to be driven inward, and is made in the hollow place, as happens to the ribs when they are struck, and part of their entrance is driven inward.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	This is more common in the bones of moist bodies, such as the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And in all these types of fractures, the pieces are scattered, like separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come to restore all of that to its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we recognize all these types of fractures by probing them, and by investigating them with probes and the removal of corrupted flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	A particular type is recognized because it is uncovered on the bone, and is cleaned and rubbed with a probe, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of a fracture, consider first the patient's symptoms.  Then, if you see symptoms that indicate significant danger, such as vomiting, diarrhea, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, fainting, high fever, swelling and stiffness of the limbs, and similar severe symptoms, the patient is in doubt, and will not likely recover.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see less severe symptoms, you expect recovery, then you begin the treatment.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the afflicted person came to you at the beginning of the affliction, as in the winter months, you should consider removing the bone before the 14th day, according to the patient's condition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is during the summer months, then you should remove the bone before the 7th day, lest the area beneath the bone be corrupted by swelling, and the symptoms we have described occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the soft tissue covering the brain, and is with broken and crushed parts, then you should incise the broken and crushed parts, as I will explain to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you should shave the head of the afflicted patient, and uncover the bone according to the custom and method appropriate to you, based on the nature of the affliction, and so that it is gentle on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you encounter bone exposure, blood flow, or a painful abscess, then you should oppose it with whatever is necessary, filling the area with cloths soaked in warmed wine and oil, and allowing the affliction to rest until the abscess subsides and the blood flow ceases; then begin with the cleaning of the bone and its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this should be done according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you cut the bone with a narrow, sharp scalpel, and this is its form:  And then apply another scalpel, a little wider than the first; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then apply a scalpel wider than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary to have several different scalpels at your disposal, some wider than others; and some of them shorter than others, with sharpened edges, made of tempered iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in striking the scalpel, so that you don't strike the head and damage it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then it is necessary to drill a hole around it before you apply the scalpels with the drills, which are called non-deepening drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named thus, except because they do not penetrate the bone's surface, as the drill's tip or edge that is below the pointed head is similar to a small edge or circle, which prevents submersion and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a large number of these drills, each appropriate to the thickness of each bone, so that you have on hand for every skull bone a drill tip that is sharp, its length and shortness adjusted to the thickness of that particular bone.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the method for three types of drills:  To drill around a fractured bone, place the drill on the bone and turn it with your fingers until you know the bone is penetrated; then change the drill to another location, and make a hole roughly the size of the ray's thickness or approximately that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then you make incisions with scalpels between each hole in the bone, making it as thin as possible, as we have said, until you have removed the bone, either with your hand or with some other instrument you have prepared, such as fine pliers and forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you must be very careful that the scalpel does not touch any part of the skull.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And once you have drilled around the bone, and if it is still connected to the skull, you must remove it by scraping and smoothing the rough edges of the bone with another tool similar to a scalpel, but it must be thinner and finer than the other scalpels.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small pieces of bone remain, then remove them easily with the tools you have; and then treat the wound with liniments and ointments as we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other method of operation is gentle, free of fear, which Gualo described and praised highly; and this is his teaching: It is necessary for you at the beginning to begin uncovering the part of the bone in the location of the most severe and obvious fracture, until when you have uncovered that part and have placed beneath it the tip of this slow and gentle scalpel, of which this is the shape:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular part is blunt and does not cut anything, and the pointed part is on two sides, forward in length, like you see; so that the lenticular part is attached to the skull with the pointed cutting side against the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike the scalpel on one side with a small hammer until you cut through the entire bone with ease, as it has been turned; and you are certain of the skin that no accident will happen to it in any way. And if the physician were the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then, if any cause remains attached to the bone of the skin in certain places of the bone, you will cut it with the tip of the lenticular scalpel, and will release it with ease, for it is released without harm or fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the skin, and what is cut or removed from the bone is its surface, and it remains rough and with subtle irregularities, then it is necessary to smooth that roughness and remove those irregularities with thin razors, for which you have prepared various quantities, so that it is possible for you to apply the most suitable ones in every place and the most appropriate ones according to what you have in mind when you perform your operation on that broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And it is necessary that in your procedure, with which you smooth the bone, you start with the widest of those razors, and then proceed to use the finest of them, and do not cease doing this successively until you come to using the finest and most subtle of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	However, in each of the other small, capillary fractures and subtle fractures, you must apply treatment according to what you perceive as necessary for their rectification.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause not hidden from all those who have studied that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this, which we have written, demonstrates it in major fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the pannicle is retracted when you reduce the bone, then you must take a cloth according to the size of the wound, immerse it in warmed oil, and place it over the wound's opening; then take another cloth, doubled or tripled, and immerse it in wine and warmed oil, and place this on the first cloth, doing so as gently as possible, so as not to weigh down the wound; then apply a wide bandage over it, and do not tighten it more than is necessary to simply hold the wound closed.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave it with this treatment for a day or two until you are sure of a hot abscess; then remove it and apply medicines that are effective against dryness, such as flax seeds, barley flour, ashes, and similar powders.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And you should make these medicines into a powder, pulverized and applied to the wound, just as they are dried; and universally, apply any medicine whose property is to cleanse and not to irritate.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful, according to your skill, that the wound, in your treatment, remains clean, and is not clogged with ointment or anything else; nor allow the wound to become infected with harmful substances, for when they are applied to the membranes of the brain they corrupt and pollute it, and bring upon the patient an extremely harmful illness.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And this can happen in the skull, especially when the treatment of the bone is neglected, and there is blackening on its surface; therefore, if you observe the symptoms we have mentioned, know that this is a serious illness without a doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if the darkening is not from the wound itself but from the medicine applied, and the medicine itself is causing the darkening, then you should take one part honey and three parts of rubbed olive oil, and with these, moisten a cloth, then place it on the skull; and then treat it with the appropriate healing remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken in two parts simultaneously, but sometimes only in one.  This is because there are two bones in the nose; the lower part is cartilaginous and is not broken, but is only bruised, twisted, and deformed.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts is broken, then you should insert your little finger into the nose, and with your index finger press the fracture inward, and with your thumb outward, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this with ease, and be careful not to cause more pain to the patient with your procedure.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the upper part of the nose, and the finger cannot reach it, then it must be set with the end of a tool with a small, rounded tip.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And strive for a restoration within the first day of the fracture, if possible; if not, then approximately the 7th or 10th, you must apply a soothing poultice.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And approximately insert a piece of linen cloth into the nasal opening, if the fracture is in one part, or put two pads, if the fracture is in two parts, and the pad should have enough bulk to fill the nasal cavity.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient healers say the pads should be soaked in a broth and changed daily, but I do not find this necessary.  Instead, the cloth should be soaked in a mixture of beaten egg and powdered spice.  Then leave the pad in place until the bone is set and the cartilage has hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes, instead of a pad, a bird's feather wrapped in linen is placed in the nose.  This is done when the nasal fracture is severe and the patient is not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this method is not necessary for you; if you wish, use this, and if you wish, use pads.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if there is an abscess again, apply a plaster to the nose made with cerot or cotton dipped in sour wine and rose oil, or with diachylon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	However, if there is no suppurating abscess, then you should cover the external part with flour, powdered incense mixed with egg white.  Then place a linen bandage over that, and do not bind the nose with anything else.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the nasal bones are broken with a small fracture or are comminuted, then you should cut around them and remove them with instruments suitable for this; then close the wound and treat it with things that promote healing and consolidation, and with appropriate plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is an ulcer inside the nose, then you should treat it with pads and administer lead cannulas until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter 4.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Concerning the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the lower jaw is broken and the fracture is not accompanied by an open wound, then consider if the fracture is only outward, and not broken in two but bent inward at the edges, then its repositioning is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And thus, if the fracture is on the right side, you should insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; and similarly, if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert the said index finger of your right hand; and push the bend of the fracture inward with ease towards the outside, with your other hand on the outside of the bone; with that, gently straighten it.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two pieces, then it is necessary to apply extension to both parts according to their alignment until their reunion is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if you encounter a loosening of teeth along with a breakage, then hold those you expect to remain with gold, silver, or silk thread; then place a poultice on the broken jaw, then place a doubled cloth over it, and place a large, properly made bandage or a piece of lead, equal to the length of the jaw; and then tie it on top as you have the means to do so, applying the bandage, until it is healed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And order the patient to use rest and tranquility, and give him easily digestible food.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that the shape has already been altered in any way, then you should remove and loosen it on the third day; and then you should correct whatever has been altered, and plaster it with powdered moli, with egg white, or with flour of oats, after removing the poultice, and place a soft wool bandage over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	Then, when this plaster is properly applied and the bone's position isn't further altered, leave it, do not remove it until the fracture is healed and strong; for often this fracture is healed in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another time a painful boil occurs, then administer what we have said many times for its reduction until it is healed, and the boil is resolved.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with a plaque, then consider whether it is a piece of the bone separated or splinters; then carefully remove those splinters with whatever is appropriate for that in the removal of splinters from the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then you should widen it with leeches according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then, when you have removed those splinters, and nothing further remains, then you dress the wound opening if it is wide; and if not, apply one of the appropriate plasters to it and allow it to heal until it is sound.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is fractured.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Often the collarbone is fractured on the part in front of the muscle, and that fracture occurs in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	When it is fractured, or separated, or separated into two parts without any splinters, its restoration is easy; or it is splintered and difficult to restore; or the fracture is with an open wound.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that case, when the fracture is without an open wound, is that you have two assistants present, so that one holds and steadies the fractured collarbone, and the other stretches the neck towards that area.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then grasp the fracture with your fingers until its shape is correctly formed, and is neither too prominent nor concave.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you require more extension, then you should place under the patient's neck a pad of cloth or wool, sized according to your needs; and extend and elevate the collarbone and compress the pad with your hand until you have correctly aligned the fracture.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot pull the collarbone's end outward because it has adhered to the bone, then the patient should be placed supine on their neck, and you should place a cushion of medium size upon the patient's muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant presses the muscle below, so that the collarbone's bone is lifted away from the adhesion, and then you straighten the fracture and grasp it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel splinters of the collarbone and they are loose, then you should cut around them and easily remove those splinters.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is embedded in the bone, then you create an incision with one of the scalpels you have prepared for this, having placed the instrument used for the chisel beneath the collarbone; and this instrument is made of wood or iron, of which this is its shape:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a scoop, whose concavity is this; and its width should be according to your needs, depending on the size of the bone or the little amount of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length should be according to what is possible for you in the operation; let it have two ends, like a wedge, and one end be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the rupture of the wound you have incised when you have extracted the splinter from the bone is wide, and you are sure of a hot abscess, then you should bring together the two edges of the wound with sutures.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the rupture is small, or you fear a hot abscess, then you should fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the size of the wound's cut.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if a hot abscess occurs, then soak a cloth in vinegar, and rubbed oil and wine, and place it on top.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But if the fracture of the bone, when there is no wound or incision, you should place a plaster made of ground flour with egg white, and place a lion's cloth over it. Then place a splint below the patient's armpit, if needed, and then take a bandage, that is, a towel like those the Saracens use, which is very long, and its width is about a palm or so.  Then put double layers of powder over the cloth and plaster. Then take a thin, table-like splint whose width is about three fingers and of similar length.  Then wrap that in cloth, and then wrap the cloth and splint around the area over the fracture site.  Then place a bandage in the shape of a sling, and wrap it around the patient’s neck and under the patient's armpit and under the armpit of the ill person, and wrap it around the whole area. This is so that if the fracture is tightening, and there is no concealment on your part.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And ensure that the splint does not move away from the broken bone.  Therefore, you should see the patient daily, and when you see that the ligament is softened or the splint has become loose, then you should rectify this and tighten the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Then place the patient's pillow on their neck, and place a small cushion under their armpit beneath the pillow at night.  This is so that the patient's shoulder is elevated from the side of the wound, and thus the fracture of the clavicle is elevated from the muscle; or the patient's arm is tied to the neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	Do not loosen the bandage unless there is a suppuration or abscess in the area, until twelve days have passed.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	Then renew the plaster if you see the patient's skin reacting to it, and adjust it around the fracture, and leave it until the fracture of the clavicle is restored and solidified.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comfortable within twenty-eight days, and sometimes in some men it is completed in less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a fractured shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The shoulder blade is fractured at a point lateral to it, and it is not fractured from the center, but from the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore, when the fracture is located — and it is fractured in the middle of it — and is only known by touch, then according to the nature of the fracture, prepare it and restore it to its natural form by any means possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then place on the area powder of millstones mixed with egg white and stop it; and then place a folded cloth; and then place a thin sheet of lead over it, according to the size of the entire shoulder blade or a little more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if beneath the lead there is a hollow in any part of the shoulder blade, then you fill that hollow with plaster, and then raise the lead to an equal level.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then press it (the lead) from above with a long, appropriate constriction and firm pressure on the lead until it is no longer displaced from its position.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the ligature every day; and every time it is softened, bind it again and press it and re-position the lead if it has been displaced from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And let the patient lie on their sound side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the shoulder blade is restored in 20 or 25 days.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore, when this number of days has been completed, then you dissolve the ligature, and you must know for certain that it is from the bones from which the commencement is not feared, nor is their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the location of the weighty bone and place the splint underneath, then you cut it, remove it, and do as we said regarding the fracture of the furcula, for the treatment of an abscess, if this is the case here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of a fractured foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot is sometimes broken in the middle, and this is less serious; but its extremities are often more seriously torn and crushed.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And the symptoms when the middle of the foot is broken include:  deviation of the parts inwards, great pain, difficulty breathing, coughing, considerable weakness, and vomiting blood; and the broken bone cavity is apparent and not hidden from feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient be placed on their back, and a cushion be placed between their shoulder blades;  then firmly press on the muscles, and join the bones together with both hands, being meticulous in the procedure and adjusting according to every possible method and what is appropriate, until the bone returns to its proper shape.
